</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(l)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	in the event of termination of the Optionee&#146;s Service (whether or not in breach of local labor laws), the Optionee&#146;s right to receive an Option and vest in the Option under the Plan, if any, will terminate
	effective as of the date that the Optionee is no longer actively employed and will not be extended by any notice period mandated under local law (e.g., active employment would not include a period of &#147;garden leave&#148; or similar period
	pursuant to local law); the Administrator shall have the exclusive discretion to determine when the Optionee is no longer actively employed for purposes of the Option;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(m)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Company is not providing any tax, legal or financial advice, nor is the Company making any recommendations regarding the Optionee&#146;s participation in the Plan or the Optionee&#146;s acquisition or sale of the
	underlying shares of Common Stock; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(n)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Optionee is hereby advised to consult with the Optionee&#146;s personal tax, legal and financial advisors regarding the Optionee&#146;s participation in the Plan before taking any action related to the Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	France
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This information is
	correct as of November 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the Optionee retains Shares outside of France or maintains a foreign bank account, the Optionee is required to report such to the French tax authorities
	when filing his or her annual tax return.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Germany
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cross-border payments in
	excess of &#128;&nbsp;12,500 must be reported monthly to the German Federal Bank. If the Optionee uses a German bank to transfer a cross-border payment in excess of &#128;&nbsp;12,500 in connection with the sale of shares of Common Stock acquired
	under the Plan, the bank will make the report for the Optionee. In addition, the Optionee must report any receivables or payables or debts in foreign currency exceeding &#128;&nbsp;5,000,000 on a monthly basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Hong Kong
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Obligation to report the share
	option gains to the tax authority
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee is obliged to declare the gains realized by the exercise, assignment or release of the share options to
	the Hong Kong Inland Revenue Department (&#147;IRD&#148;) in their Individual Tax Return for the year of assessment in which the share options are exercised, assigned or released. If the Optionee is eligible to lodge any offshore
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-taxable
</FONT>
	claim on their share option gains, the Optionee is required to lodge such claim in their Individual Tax Return. Therefore, it is the Optionee&#146;s responsibility to prove to the satisfaction of the IRD
	on their
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-taxable
</FONT>
	claim lodged with documentary evidence in support.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Reporting requirement
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the commencement of Hong Kong employment/assignment of the Optionee, the Optionee&#146;s employer (the &#147;Employer&#148;) is obliged to file the
	Commencement Notice (Form IR 56E) for reporting the term of employment and share options details to the IRD within 3 months from the date of commencement of employment. Annual Employer&#146;s Return (Form IR 56B) is required to be filed to the IRD
	by end of April to report the remuneration paid/accrued to the Optionee, including the share option gains, for each year ended 31 March. Further to the filing of the said Forms, the IRD will normally create
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	a tax file for the Optionee and issue the annual Individual Tax Return to the Optionee (usually in May) to ascertain their tax position. If there is no Individual Tax Return issued by the IRD to
	the Optionee for reporting the share option gain in the year of exercise, the Optionee is obliged to voluntarily inform the IRD on this tax chargeability arising from the exercise as well as other Hong Kong taxable employment income within four
	months after the end of the basis period during which the year of assessment is concerned (i.e. the informing deadline is 31&nbsp;July given the fiscal year ends on 31 March).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Leaving Hong Kong
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the share option is only exercised,
	assigned or released
<U>
	after
</U>
	the Optionee permanently departs from Hong Kong, the Employer should report the share option gains by filing the Departure Notice (Form IR 56G) and provide a copy for the Optionee. The Optionee also needs to
	discharge their voluntary informing chargeability obligation as mentioned above not later than 4 months after the end of the year of assessment in which the share option gains are derived. Even if the Employer fails to submit the Departure Notice to
	report the taxable share option gain, the Optionee still needs to comply with their own reporting obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In order to assist with finalizing the
	salary-related tax liabilities prior to permanent departure, the Optionee is allowed, as a concession, to elect to have the tax liabilities finalized on the basis of a notional exercise of the share options. The notional gain is calculated on the
	basis as if the options had been exercised on a day within 7 days before the date of submission of the Optionee&#146;s tax return for the final year of assessment in which the Optionee departs. As a further concession, the IRD is prepared to accept
	an election made within 3 months from the date of departure from Hong Kong if no election has been made before departure. In this case, the date of departure will be taken as the date of notional exercise for the purpose of calculating the gain.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An election once made cannot be withdrawn before the actual exercise, assignment or release, except:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	within the objection period of the assessment in which the gain of the notional exercise is included; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	total forfeiture of the options with no replacement or compensation before the actual exercise.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If it
	transpires that the gain in respect of the actual exercise, assignment or release is less than the amount assessed in respect of the notional exercise, the IRD has indicated in its Departmental Interpretation and Practice Note that they will
	favorably consider any application for appropriate amendment and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-assessment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Withholding
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The paragraphs below supplement Section&nbsp;8 (Withholding) of Exhibit A to the Option Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Employer is not required to withhold the Optionee&#146;s share option gains unless the Optionee permanently departs from Hong Kong. The Employer is
	statutorily required to withhold money payment from the Optionee for a period of one month after the Departure Notification (Form IR 56G) was filed to the IRD, unless consent (by the issue of a Letter of Release to the employer with a copy to the
	Optionee after they have settled all their tax liabilities) is given by the IRD. Hence, if the Optionee derives share option gains and there is money paid to them by the Employer, the Employer has the withholding obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	India
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As per the foreign exchange laws (&#147;regulations&#148;) in India, there are no restrictions on the amount of remittances that the Optionee can make for
	acquiring Options provided that the following conditions are fulfilled:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company issuing the shares effectively, directly or indirectly, holds in the Indian company, whose employees / directors are being offered shares, not less than 51% of its equity, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The shares under the Plan are offered by the issuing company globally on a uniform basis (with the same terms and with the same rights)
<I>
	.
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Ireland
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Restriction on Types of Shares Issued
	to Directors
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the Optionee is a director or shadow director of an Irish Subsidiary, the Optionee&#146;s Options will be paid in newly issued shares
	of Common Stock only. In no event will the Options be settled in treasury shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Director Notification Requirement
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the Optionee is a director, shadow director or secretary of an Irish Subsidiary, the Optionee must notify the Irish Subsidiary in writing within five
	business days of receiving or disposing of an interest in the Company (
<I>
	e.g
</I>
	., Options, shares of Common Stock, etc.), or within five business days of becoming aware of the event giving rise to the notification requirement, or within five
	business days of becoming a director or secretary if such an interest exists at the time. This notification requirement also applies with respect to the interests of a spouse or minor children (whose interests will be attributed to the director,
	shadow director or secretary).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Italy
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This
	information is correct as of August 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Purpose
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Plan is discretionary in nature and is offered only to individual employees and/or specific categories of employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Nature of Plan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This provision supplements
	Section&nbsp;11 (Acknowledgement of Nature of Plan and Option) of Exhibit A to the Option Agreement:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee understands that the Company has
	unilaterally, gratuitously and discretionally decided to grant Options under the Plan to individuals who may be employees of the Company or its Subsidiaries throughout the world. The decision is a limited decision that is entered into upon the
	express assumption and condition that any grant will not bind the Company or any Related Company. Consequently, the Optionee understands that the Option is granted on the assumption and condition that the Option and any shares of Common Stock
	acquired upon exercise of the Option are not a part of any employment contract (either with the Company or any Related Company) and shall not be considered a mandatory benefit, salary for any purposes (including severance compensation) or any other
	right whatsoever. Further, the Optionee understands that the Optionee will not be entitled to continue vesting in any Option once the Optionee&#146;s Service with the Company or any Related Company ceases. In addition, the Option understands that
	this grant would not be made to the Optionee but for the assumptions and conditions referred to above; thus, the Optionee acknowledges and freely accepts that should any or all of the assumptions be mistaken or should any of the conditions not be
	met for any reason, then any grant of or right to the Option shall be null and void.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	It is a condition of participation in the Plan that the Optionee
	expressly agrees to the terms of the Plan, including the provisions in this Exhibit B.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Options Payable Only in Shares of Common Stock
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding any discretion in the Plan or anything contrary in the Option Agreement, if the Optionee is resident in Italy, the grant of Options does not
	provide any right for the Optionee to receive a cash payment and the Options are payable in shares of Common Stock only.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Securities Reporting
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Individuals in Italy are required to report assets held abroad on their annual tax returns (Form RW) if the value of such assets exceeds 10,000 Euros at the
	end of the calendar year. The Italian tax authorities have taken the position that vested Stock Options in a foreign company are considered &#145;assets held abroad&#146;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Employees must therefore also report vested Stock Options in their annual tax returns (Form Unico, Schedule RW) if the threshold is exceeded.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, employees must report in Section III of Form RW the transfer of money exceeding 10,000 Euros:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	From Italy to another jurisdiction;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	From another jurisdiction to Italy;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Between
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-Italian
</FONT>
	jurisdictions, if the transfer relates to investments held overseas.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This also applies to transfers to countries that have adopted the Euro.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Japan
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This information is correct as of August
	2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Although there
	are no restrictions on the transfer of funds outside Japan, certain reporting obligations to the tax authorities or the Ministry of Finance may be required.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Optionees must notify the Ministry of Finance of share purchases in excess of 30,000,000 Yen. An additional notification is required for purchase of shares
	with a value in excess of 100,000,000 Yen.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Japanese banks including Japanese branches of foreign banks have to report transfers of funds of more than
	1,000,000 Yen in and out of Japan to the government automatically. Sometimes the tax authorities check individual tax returns to these records.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Netherlands
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By participating in the Plan the
	Optionee acknowledges that the Optionee&#146;s Options can cease to vest on termination of employment under the terms of the Plan. It is a condition of participation in the Plan that the Optionee agrees to these terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Poland
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Securities reporting
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the Optionee holds more than &#128;10,000 of foreign securities (including following the grant of Options) the Optionee must declare details of the shares
	and options (whether or not the options have vested)
<I>
</I>
	&nbsp;to the National Bank of Poland. The form of declaration must be submitted within 30 days of the end of the year.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Russia
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This information is correct as of August 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Options
	Payable Only in Shares of Common Stock
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding any discretion in the Plan or anything contrary in the Option Agreement, if the Optionee is
	resident in Russia, the grant of Options does not provide any right for the Optionee to receive a cash payment and the Options are payable in shares of Common Stock only.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee has a
	reporting obligation to inform the Russian tax authorities of any bank accounts opened outside of Russia (This applies to Russian national employees only).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Singapore
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Leaving Singapore
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With effect from January&nbsp;1, 2003, Optionees who are foreign citizens or are Singapore Permanent residents leaving Singapore permanently are taxed on a
	&#147;deemed exercise&#148; basis for any options or units or shares granted or issued during Singapore employment. This would also include any unvested or restricted options or units or shares granted whilst exercising employment in Singapore.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As per the deemed exercise rule, all Options, units, or stock which have been granted during Singapore employment are deemed to have been exercised,
	irrespective whether the Options have vested or not. The taxable value is the difference between the fair market value (which would be the fair market value one month prior to the date of departure) and the exercise price.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Director withholding
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Independent Directors who are Non
	Resident in Singapore and have received Options by virtue of their being on the Board of the Singapore Company will be subject to tax in Singapore and liable for tax withholding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Spain
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This provision supplements Section&nbsp;15
	(Acknowledgment of Nature of Plan and Option) of Exhibit A to the Option Agreement:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accepting the Options, the Optionee consents to participation in
	the Plan and acknowledges that the Optionee has received a copy of the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee understands that the Company has unilaterally, gratuitously and
	discretionally decided to grant Options under the Plan to individuals who may be employees of the Company or its Subsidiaries throughout the world. The decision is a limited decision that is entered into upon the express assumption and condition
	that any grant will not bind the Company or any Related Company. Consequently, the Optionee understands that the Options are granted on the assumption and condition that the Options and any shares of Common Stock acquired upon exercise of the
	Options are not a part of any employment contract (either with the Company or any Related Company) and shall not be considered a mandatory benefit, salary for any purposes (including severance compensation) or any other right whatsoever. Further,
	the Optionee understands that the Optionee will not be entitled to continue vesting in any Options
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	once the Optionee&#146;s Service with the Company or any Related Company ceases. In addition, the Optionee understands that this grant would not be made to the Optionee but for the assumptions
	and conditions referred to above; thus, the Optionee acknowledges and freely accepts that should any or all of the assumptions be mistaken or should any of the conditions not be met for any reason, then any grant of or right to the Options shall be
	null and void.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exchange Control Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Optionee must declare the acquisition of shares of Common Stock to the Direcci&oacute;n General de Pol&iacute;tica Comercial e Inversiones Exteriores (the DGPCIE) of the Ministerio de Econom&iacute;a for statistical purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As the shares are listed on a stock exchange the acquisition will be filled in a form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	D-5B.
</FONT>
	The form will be declared
	to the Registro de Inversiones of the Direcci&oacute;n General de Pol&iacute;tica Comercial e Inversiones Exteriores of the Ministerio de Industria, Turismo y Comercio.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee must also declare ownership of any shares of Common Stock with the Directorate of Foreign Transactions each January whilst the shares of Common
	Stock are owned in the following cases:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The shares of the company are listed on the stock exchange.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The shareholding in the company has to be at least 10% or more.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The investment is more than 1,502,530.26 Euros.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Foreign currency payments (i.e., dividends or sale proceeds)
	have to be declared when the amount exceed 6,010.12 Euros on form B3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The information provided to the financial institution is the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>

	&nbsp;
</P>

	No country specific terms and conditions apply.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	United
	Kingdom
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Withholding
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The paragraphs below
	replace Section&nbsp;8 (Withholding) of Exhibit A to the Option Agreement:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Regardless of any action the Company or the Optionee&#146;s employer (the
	&#147;Employer&#148;) takes with respect to any or all income tax, primary and secondary Class&nbsp;1 National Insurance contributions, payroll tax or other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	tax-related
</FONT>
	withholding attributable to or payable
	in connection with or pursuant to the grant, vesting, exercise, release or assignment of any Option
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items&#148;), the Optionee acknowledges that the ultimate liability for all
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items legally due by the Optionee is and remains the Optionee&#146;s responsibility. Furthermore, the Company and/or the Employer (i)&nbsp;make no representations or
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	undertakings regarding the treatment of any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items in connection with any aspect of the Option, including the grant, vesting or exercise of the
	Options, the subsequent sale of any shares of Common Stock acquired at exercise and the receipt of any dividends; and (ii)&nbsp;do not commit to structure the terms of the grant or any aspect of the Option to reduce or eliminate the Optionee&#146;s
	liability for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a condition of any Options becoming exercisable and the issuance of shares of
	Common Stock upon exercise of the Options, the Company and/or the Employer shall be entitled to withhold and the Optionee agrees to pay, or make adequate arrangements satisfactory to the Company and/or the Employer to satisfy, all obligations of the
	Company and/or the Employer to account to HM Revenue&nbsp;&amp; Customs (&#147;HMRC&#148;) for any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items by the Due Date, which is 90 days, or such other period as required under U.K. law, after
	the event giving rise to the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items (the &#147;Chargeable Event&#148;). In this regard, except as provided in the next sentence, such payment shall be made by means of the Company withholding and/or
	reacquiring a number of shares of Common Stock issued upon exercise of the Options having a Fair Market Value equal to the amount of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items that the Company determines it or the Employer is required
	to account to HMRC under applicable tax laws with respect to the Options (with such obligation determined based on any applicable minimum statutory withholding rates). In the event that the Company cannot (under applicable legal, regulatory, listing
	or other requirements, or otherwise) satisfy such obligation in such method, the Company may satisfy its entitlement to withhold under this Option Agreement by either or a combination of the following methods: (i)&nbsp;by requiring the Optionee to
	pay such amount in cash or check; and/or (ii)&nbsp;by deducting such amount out of any other compensation otherwise payable to the Optionee. For these purposes, the Fair Market Value of the shares of Common Stock to be withheld or repurchased, as
	applicable, shall be determined on the date that
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items are to be determined.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Optionee shall pay
	to the Company or the Employer any amount of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items that the Company or the Employer may be required to account to HMRC with respect to the Chargeable Event that cannot be satisfied by the means
	previously described. If payment or withholding is not made by the Due Date, the Optionee agrees that the amount of any uncollected
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items shall (assuming the Optionee is not a director or executive
	officer of the Company (within the meaning of Section 13(k) of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended)), constitute a loan owed by the Optionee to the Employer, effective on the Due Date. The Optionee agrees that the loan will bear
	interest at the then-current HMRC Official Rate and it will be immediately due and repayable, and the Company and/or the Employer may recover it at any time thereafter by any of the means referred to above. If any of the foregoing methods of
	collection are not allowed under Applicable Laws or if the Optionee fails to comply with the Optionee&#146;s obligations in connection with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items as described in this section, the Company may
	refuse to deliver the shares of Common Stock acquired under the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Joint Election
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a condition to exercising the Options, the Optionee agrees to accept any liability for secondary Class&nbsp;1 National Insurance contributions (the
	&#147;Employer&#146;s Liability&#148;) which may be payable by the Company and/or the Employer in connection with the Options and any event giving rise to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items. To accomplish the foregoing, the
	Optionee agrees to execute a joint election with the Company (the &#147;Election&#148;), the form of such Election being formally approved by HMRC, and any other consent or elections required to accomplish the transfer of the Employer&#146;s
	Liability to the Optionee. The Optionee further agrees to execute such other joint elections as may be required between the Optionee and any successor to the Company and/or the Employer. If the Optionee does not enter into the Election when the
	Optionee accepts the Option Agreement or when otherwise requested by the Company and/or Employer, or if the Election is revoked at any time by HMRC, the Optionee will not be entitled to exercise the Option unless the Optionee agree to pay an amount
	equal to the Employer&#146;s Liability to the Company, the Employer and/or any Related Company. The Optionee further agrees that the Company and/or the Employer may collect the Employer&#146;s Liability by any of the means set forth in the
	Withholding section of the Option Agreement.}
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_10>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notice of Grant of Award and Award Agreement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	You have been granted an award of Restricted Stock Units pursuant to the terms of the Pegasystems Inc. Amended and Restated 2004 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the
	&#147;Plan&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If you have not yet completed the acceptance process for any of your awards, you may complete the acceptance process by
	(A)&nbsp;reviewing your award details, (B)&nbsp;reviewing your award documents listed in this Section B of your Online Award Acceptance (the &#147;Award Documents&#148;), and (C)&nbsp;confirming your acceptance of your award.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By accepting this award, you agree that this award is granted and governed by the terms and conditions of the Plan, this notice, and all your Award Documents
	listed herein and incorporated by reference. This notice, together with your Award Documents and your electronic acceptance, collectively comprise your total agreement (the &#147;Award Agreement&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Pegasystems Inc.

</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	By:
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/24/0001193125-17-056299_G316984G43Y03.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;

</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Alan Trefler, Chairman and

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Chief Executive Officer

</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Notice of Grant of Award and Award Agreement for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	{Non-}
</FONT>
	U.S. Employees
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Conversion of Restricted Stock Units to Common Stock
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	Each restricted stock unit (&#147;RSU&#148;)
	granted in the Notice of Grant of Award and Award Agreement {for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-U.S.
</FONT>
	Employees} (of which this
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	is a part) (the &#147;Award Agreement&#148;) represents the right of the person receiving
	such grant (the &#147;Recipient&#148;) to receive one share of the common stock (&#147;Common Stock&#148;) of Pegasystems Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) subject to the vesting requirements listed in the Award Agreement and to the other terms and
	conditions of this Award Agreement. On each vesting date listed in the Award Agreement, the Company will issue such number of shares of Common Stock as are equal to the applicable number of RSUs vesting on such date, less such number of shares of
	Common Stock as are required to be withheld to satisfy Recipient&#146;s tax withholding obligations. The Recipient shall not be entitled to receive any dividends declared on shares of Common Stock for any periods prior to the relevant vesting date,
	nor shall the Recipient be entitled to any dividend equivalent payouts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Vesting
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	RSUs will
	vest on the dates listed in the Award Agreement if the Recipient remains in the active employment of the Company {and/or the Recipient&#146;s employer (the &#147;Employer&#148;)} in good standing from the date of grant through the applicable vesting
	date. RSUs will cease to vest immediately upon the cessation of Recipient&#146;s active employment with the Company, for any reason.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Recipient&#146;s Agreement
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Recipient agrees to all the terms stated in the Award Agreement
	(of which this Exhibit is a part), as well as to the terms of the Plan (which shall control in case of conflict with the Award Agreement), a copy of which is attached and of which the Recipient acknowledges receipt.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Withholding
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Recipient consents to fulfill all withholding obligations for all applicable
	payroll and income taxes with respect to the Award when they are due and arrange for satisfactory payment of all withholding obligations in a manner as set forth in Section 13(h) of the Plan. The Company may satisfy such withholding obligations by
	withholding such number of shares of Common Stock as are equal in value to the amount of the required withholding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	{4. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Withholding
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	Regardless of any action the Company and/or the Employer take with respect to any or all income tax (including U.S. federal, state and local tax and/or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	tax),
	social insurance, payroll tax, payment on account or other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	tax-related
</FONT>
	withholding
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items&#148;), the Recipient acknowledges that the ultimate
	liability for all
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items legally due by the Recipient is and remains the Recipient&#146;s responsibility and that the Company and/or the Employer (i)&nbsp;make no representations or undertakings
	regarding the treatment of any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items in connection with any aspect of the Award, including the grant of the RSUs, the vesting of the RSUs, the delivery of shares of Common Stock, the subsequent
	sale of any shares of Common Stock acquired at vesting and the receipt of any dividends or dividend equivalents; and (ii)&nbsp;do not commit to structure the terms of the grant or any aspect of the Award to reduce or eliminate the Recipient&#146;s
	liability for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to the relevant taxable event, the Recipient shall pay or
	make arrangements satisfactory to the Company and/or the Employer to satisfy all withholding and payment on account obligations of the Company and/or the Employer. In this regard, the Recipient authorizes the Company and/or the Employer to withhold
	all applicable
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items legally payable by the Recipient from any wages or other cash compensation paid to the Recipient by the Company and/or the Employer. Alternatively, or in addition, if
	permissible under local law, the Recipient authorizes the Company and/or the Employer, at its discretion and pursuant to such procedures as it may specify from time to time, to satisfy the obligations with regard to all
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items legally payable by the Recipient by one or a combination of the following: (i)&nbsp;withholding otherwise deliverable shares of Common Stock, provided that the Company only withholds the amount of
	shares of Common Stock necessary to satisfy the minimum withholding amount; (ii)&nbsp;arranging for the sale of shares of Common Stock otherwise deliverable to the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Recipient (on the Recipient&#146;s behalf and at the Recipient&#146;s direction pursuant to this authorization); or (iii)&nbsp;withholding from the proceeds of the sale of shares of Common Stock
	acquired upon vesting of the Award. If the obligation for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items is satisfied by withholding a number of shares of Common Stock as described herein, the Recipient is deemed to have been issued the
	full number of shares of Common Stock subject to the Award, notwithstanding that a number of the shares of Common Stock are held back solely for the purpose of paying the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items due as a result of
	any aspect of the Award. The Recipient shall pay to the Company and/or the Employer any amount of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items that the Company and/or the Employer may be required to withhold as a result of the
	Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan that cannot be satisfied by the means previously described. The Company may refuse to deliver to the Recipient any shares of Common Stock pursuant to the Award if the Recipient fails to comply with the
	Recipient&#146;s obligations in connection with the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items as described in this section.}
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Rights as Shareholders
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Recipient shall have no rights as a shareholder of the Company with
	respect to any of the RSUs until the issuance of shares of Common Stock at the time of vesting, and then only with respect to those shares of Common Stock issued.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Transferability
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Award may not be transferred in
	any manner other than as permitted in Section 13(j) of the Plan {by will or by the laws of descent and distribution}. The terms of the Award shall be binding upon the executors, administrators, heirs and successors of the Recipient.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Compliance with Securities, Tax and Other Law
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	No shares of Common Stock may be issued if the
	issuance of shares would constitute a violation of any applicable federal or state securities law or any other law or valid regulation. As a condition to issuance of Common Stock, the Company may require the Recipient, or any person acquiring the
	right to receive the Common Stock, to make any representation or warranty that the Company deems to be necessary under any applicable securities, tax, or other law or regulation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Adjustments upon Changes in Capitalization
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	In the event of any change in the shares subject to
	the Plan or to any Award granted under the Plan by reason of a merger, consolidation, reorganization, recapitalization, stock dividend, stock split, combination or exchange of shares of Common Stock, or other change in the structure of the Company,
	the number of RSUs and the number of shares of Common Stock shall be appropriately adjusted by the Company and such adjustment shall be final, binding and conclusive.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	No Right to Employment
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The granting of the Award does not confer upon the Recipient the right to
	continue in the service of the Company {and/or the Employer}, or affect in any way the right and power of the Company {and/or the Employer} to terminate the service of the Recipient at any time with or without assigning a reason therefor, to the
	same extent as the Company {and/or the Employer} might have done if the Award had not been granted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	No
	Guarantee
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Company offers no guarantee or assurance that the Company&#146;s stock has any value at the time of this grant or will have any value or liquidity at any future time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Standards Letter {Employment Agreement}
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	In consideration for this Award, the Recipient reaffirms the
	terms of the Recipient&#146;s Standards Letter {Employment Agreement} with Pegasystems {the Employer}, including but not limited to the provisions {(if any)} related to competition and solicitation. The Recipient further agrees that to the extent
	the nature of the Company&#146;s {Employer&#146;s} business has evolved since the date of the Standards Letter {Employment Agreement} the covenants shall also apply to the business as evolved.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage104"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	{12
<I>
	.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Acknowledgment of Nature of Plan and Award
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	In
	accepting the Award, the Recipient acknowledges that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Plan is established voluntarily by the Company, it
	is discretionary in nature, and it may be modified, amended, suspended or terminated by the Company at any time, unless otherwise provided in the Plan and this Award Agreement;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Award is voluntary and occasional and does not create any contractual or other right to receive future awards
	of RSUs, or benefits in lieu of RSUs, even if RSUs have been awarded repeatedly in the past;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all decisions
	with respect to future awards, if any, will be at the sole discretion of the Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Recipient&#146;s
	participation in the Plan is voluntary;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Award is an extraordinary item that does not constitute
	compensation for services of any kind rendered to the Company or any Related Company, and which is outside the scope of the service or employment contract, if any;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Award is not part of normal or expected compensation or salary for any purposes, including, but not limited to,
	calculation of any severance, resignation, termination, redundancy, end of service payments, bonuses, long-service awards, pension or retirement or welfare benefits or similar payments and in no event should be considered as compensation for, or
	relating in any way to, past services for the Company or any Related Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the event that the Recipient
	is not an Employee of the Company or any Related Company, the Award and the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan will not be interpreted to form an employment or service contract or relationship with the Company or any Related Company;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the future value of the underlying shares of Common Stock is unknown and cannot be predicted with any certainty;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in consideration of the Award, no claim or entitlement to compensation or damages shall arise from termination
	of the Award or from any diminution in value of the Award or shares of Common Stock acquired upon vesting of the Award resulting from termination of the Recipient&#146;s service by the Company or any Related Company (for any reason whatsoever and
	whether or not in breach of local labor laws) and the Recipient irrevocably releases the Company and any Related Company from any such claim that may arise; if, notwithstanding the foregoing, any such claim is found by a court of competent
	jurisdiction to have arisen, then, by signing the Award Agreement, the Recipient shall be deemed irrevocably to have waived the Recipient&#146;s entitlement to pursue such claim;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the event of termination of the Recipient&#146;s service (whether or not in breach of local labor laws), the
	Recipient&#146;s right to receive an Award and vest in the Award under the Plan, if any, will terminate effective as of the date that the Recipient is no longer actively employed and will not be extended by any notice period mandated under local law
	(
<I>
	e.g.
</I>
	, active employment would not include a period of &#147;garden leave&#148; or similar period pursuant to local law); the Administrator shall have the exclusive discretion to determine when the Recipient is no longer actively employed for
	purposes of the Award;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Company is not providing any tax, legal or financial advice, nor is the Company
	making any recommendations regarding the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan or the Recipient&#146;s acquisition or sale of the underlying shares of Common Stock; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Recipient is hereby advised to consult with the Recipient&#146;s personal tax, legal and financial advisors
	regarding the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan before taking any action related to the Plan.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Data Privacy Notice and Consent
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	The Recipient
	hereby explicitly and unambiguously consents to the collection, use and transfer, in electronic or other form, of the Recipient&#146;s personal data as described in this Award Agreement and any other RSU grant materials by and among, as applicable,
	the Employer, the Company and its Subsidiaries for the exclusive purpose of implementing, administering and managing the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan.
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	The Recipient understands that the Company and the Employer may hold certain personal information about the Recipient, including, but
	not limited to, the Recipient&#146;s name, home address and telephone number, date of birth, social insurance number or other identification number, salary, nationality, job title, any shares of stock or directorships held in the Company, details of
	all RSUs or any other entitlement to shares of stock awarded, granted, canceled, vested, exercised, unvested or outstanding in the Recipient&#146;s favor, for the exclusive purpose of implementing, administering and managing the Plan
	(&#147;Data&#148;).
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	The Recipient understands that Data will be transferred to a third party stock plan service provider(s)
	as may be selected by the Company, which is assisting the Company with the implementation, administration and management of the Plan. The Recipient understands the recipients of the Data may be located in the Recipient&#146;s country, in the United
	States or elsewhere, and that the data recipients&#146; country may have different data privacy laws and protections than the Recipient&#146;s country. The Recipient understands that the Recipient may request a list with the names and addresses of
	any potential recipients of the Data by contacting the Recipient&#146;s local human resources representative. The Recipient authorizes the Company and any other possible recipients which may assist the Company (presently or in the future) with
	implementing, administering and managing the Plan to receive, possess, use, retain and transfer the Data, in electronic or other form, for the sole purpose of implementing, administering and managing the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan.
	The Recipient understands that Data will be held only as long as is necessary to implement, administer and manage the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan. The Recipient understands that the Recipient may, at any time, view Data, request
	additional information about the storage and processing of Data, require any necessary amendments to Data or refuse or withdraw the consents herein, in any case without cost, by contacting in writing the Recipient&#146;s local human resources
	representative. The Recipient understands, however, that refusing or withdrawing the Recipient&#146;s consent may affect the Recipient&#146;s ability to participate in the Plan. For more information on the consequences of the Recipient&#146;s
	refusal to consent or withdrawal of consent, the Recipient understands that the Recipient may contact the Recipient&#146;s local human resources representative.}
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;{14}
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Amendment and Termination of Award
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Company may amend, modify or
	terminate any outstanding Award, provided that the Recipient&#146;s consent to such action shall be required unless it occurs pursuant to a Sale of the Company or the Committee determines that the action would not materially and adversely affect the
	Recipient.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	{15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Language
</U>
</I>
</B>
	. If the Recipient has received this Award Agreement or any other document related to
	the Plan translated into a language other than English and if the translated version is different from the English version, the English version will control.}
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	16.
</I>
</B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Electronic Delivery
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
	The Company may, in its sole discretion, decide to
	deliver any documents related to the Award or future awards made under the Plan by electronic means or request that the Recipient consent to participate in the Plan by electronic means. The Recipient hereby consents to receive such documents by
	electronic delivery and agrees to participate in the Plan through an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-line
</FONT>
	or electronic system established and maintained by the Company or a third party designated by the Company.}
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;{17}
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Governing Law and Venue
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	The Award Agreement
	shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of The Commonwealth of Massachusetts, without regard to any applicable conflicts of law provisions thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For purposes of litigating any dispute that arises directly or indirectly from the relationship of the parties evidenced by this Award or this
	Award Agreement, the parties hereby submit to and consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of The Commonwealth of Massachusetts and agree that such litigation shall be conducted only in the courts of Middlesex County, Massachusetts, or the federal
	courts for the United States for the district of Massachusetts, and no other courts, where this Award of RSUs is made and/or to be performed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;{18}
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Severability
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	In the event any one or more of the provisions of the Award Agreement shall
	for any reason be held to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable, the remaining provisions of the Award Agreement shall be unimpaired, and the invalid, illegal or unenforceable provision shall be replaced by a mutually acceptable provision, which
	being valid, legal and enforceable, comes closest to the intention of the parties underlying the invalid, illegal or unenforceable provision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;{19}
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Definitions
</U>
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	All capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined shall have the
	meanings assigned to such terms in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	{20.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Exhibit B
</U>
</I>
</B>
	.
<B>
</B>
	Notwithstanding any provision herein, the
	Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan shall be subject to any special terms and conditions as set forth in Exhibit B for the Recipient&#146;s country of residence, if any. The Exhibit B constitutes part of this Award Agreement.}
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	{Exhibit B
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	To Notice of Grant of Award and Award Agreement for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-U.S.
</FONT>
	Employees
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Exhibit B includes additional terms and conditions that govern the RSUs granted to the Recipient if the Recipient resides in the countries contained
	herein. Capitalized terms used but not defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Notice of Grant of Award and Award Agreement for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-U.S.
</FONT>
	Employees (
<U>
	of which this Exhibit B is a
	part
</U>
	) or the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Exhibit B also includes information regarding exchange controls and certain other issues of which the Recipient should be
	aware with respect to the Recipient&#146;s participation in the Plan. The information is based on the securities, exchange control and other laws in effect in the respective countries as of December 2009, unless otherwise notated. Such laws are
	often complex and change frequently. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that the Recipient not rely on the information noted herein as the only source of information relating to the consequences of the Recipient&#146;s participation in the
	Plan because the information may be out of date at the time the Recipient acquires shares of Common Stock or sells shares of Common Stock the Recipient acquires under the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the information is general in nature and may not apply to the Recipient&#146;s particular situation, and the Company is not in a position to
	assure the Recipient of any particular result.
<B>
	Accordingly, the Recipient is strongly advised to seek appropriate professional advice as to how the relevant laws in the Recipient&#146;s country apply to the Recipient&#146;s specific
	situation.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	If the Recipient is a citizen or resident of another country, or is considered a resident of another country for local law purposes,
	the information contained in this Exhibit B may not be applicable to the Recipient.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Australia
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Withholding
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This provision supplements Section&nbsp;8
	(Withholding):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to the relevant taxable event, the Recipient will provide the Company with their Australian Tax File Number (TFN) or Australian
	Business Number (ABN). Failure to do so will result in the requirement for the Company to withhold Australian tax at the rate of 46.5%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Reform to the
	taxation of Employee share schemes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With effect from 1&nbsp;July 2009, RSUs shall be taxed up front, unless there is a &#147;real risk of
	forfeiture&#148;. Where there is a &#147;real risk of forfeiture,&#148; RSUs shall generally be taxed at the earliest of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Vesting of the award (when it is no longer subject to forfeiture)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Cessation of employment
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	7 years after grant
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<U>
	Canada
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Vesting of RSUs
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax arises on the fair market
	value of the shares on vesting. No deferral election is possible for RSUs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For further clarity, any shares issued of the Common Stock of the Company
	under an RSU shall be issued solely in the name of the Recipient and not in the name of any other person, including a person with whom the Recipient is dealing at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-arm&#146;s
</FONT>
	length.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Recipient shall receive shares of the Common Stock of the Company and under no circumstances shall the
	Administrator elect to have the Recipient receive cash (or any other security) in lieu of the Common Stock of the Company. To this effect, section 13(e) of the Plan (and any other similar section) do not apply in Canada.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furthermore, at all times the Recipient should hold less than 10% of the shares of the Common Stock of the Company or any Related Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Withholding
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The paragraphs below replace Section&nbsp;4
	of Exhibit A to the Award Agreement:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Generally, there are Canadian requirements to withhold source deductions on the vesting of RSUs. Although RSU
	benefits are considered to be remuneration subject to source deductions, Canada recognizes that requiring additional withholding from cash payments, such as normal salary, as a result of a stock benefit can create hardship for the employee. This
	hardship will be created when either the benefit is very large in proportion to the employee&#146;s normal salary or the award vests later in the year. As a result, employers may make withholdings from employees&#146; cash remuneration to the extent
	possible, without imposing actual hardship. Where the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	benefit is the only form of income received from that employer, the employer will not be required to withhold tax on the amount of such benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	RSU benefits are also subject to social security taxes in Canada. These benefits are subject to Canada Pension Plan withholdings but not Employment
	Insurance withholdings. The province of Ontario will also levy payroll taxes to fund the Canadian health service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The employment benefit will be reported
	on the Recipient T4 for the year in which the RSUs vest. The Recipient must report these amounts on his or her individual income tax return for the same year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Acknowledgement of nature of plan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The paragraphs below
	replace Section&nbsp;11 of Exhibit A to the Award Agreement [new or amended paragraphs are shown in italics at g and i]:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accepting the RSU Award, the
	Recipient acknowledges that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the Plan is established voluntarily by the Company, it is discretionary in nature, and it may be modified, amended, suspended or terminated by the Company at any time, unless otherwise provided in the Plan and this
	Agreement;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

	the Award is voluntary and occasional and does not create any contractual or other right to receive future grants of RSU Awards, or benefits in lieu of RSUs, even if RSUs have been granted repeatedly in the past;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

</TD>

	long-service awards, pension or retirement or welfare benefits or similar payments and in no event should be considered as compensation for, or relating in any way to, past services for the Company or any Related Company;

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	in consideration of the Award, no claim or entitlement to compensation or damages shall arise from termination of the Award or from any diminution in value of the Award or shares of Common Stock acquired resulting from
	termination of the Recipient&#146;s service by the Company or any Related Company (for any reason whatsoever and whether or not in breach of local labor laws) and the Recipient irrevocable releases the Company and any Related Company from any such
	claim that may arise; if, notwithstanding the foregoing, any such claim is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to have arisen, then, by signing the Award Agreement, the Recipient shall be deemed irrevocably to have waived the Recipient&#146;s
	entitlement to pursue such claim;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

	in the event of termination of the Recipient&#146;s service (whether or not in breach of local labor laws), the Recipient&#146;s right to receive an Award and vest in the Award under the Plan, if any, will terminate
	effective as of the date that the Recipient is no longer actively employed and will not be extended by any notice period mandated under local law (e.g., active employment would not include a period of &#147;garden leave&#148; or similar period
	pursuant to local law); the Administrator shall have the exclusive discretion to determine when the Recipient is no longer actively employed for purposes of the Award;
</TD>
</TR>
